<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Mortal Healing](/Feats.aspx?ID=1181) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Gods & Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=17) pg. 105 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) As Mortal Healing requires you to specifically use the Treat Wounds action, it does not apply when used with other actions related to medicine or healing, such as Battle Medicine._

**Prerequisites**
[Godless Healing](/Feats.aspx?ID=869), you follow the [Laws of Mortality](/Deities.aspx?ID=201)

</column>

---

You grant greater healing when the gods don’t interfere. When you roll a success to [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=57) for a creature that hasn’t regained Hit Points from divine magic in the past 24 hours, you get a critical success on your check instead and restore the corresponding amount of Hit Points.
